name: CloudFrontDistributionConfig
description: DistributionConfig is a property of the AWS::CloudFront::Distribution property that describes which Amazon CloudFront origin servers to get your files from when users request the files through your website or application.

properties.name: Aliases
properties.desc: CNAMEs (alternate domain names), if any, for the distribution.

properties.name: CacheBehaviors
properties.desc: A list of CacheBehavior types for the distribution.

properties.name: Comment
properties.desc: Any comments that you want to include about the distribution.

properties.name: CustomErrorResponses
properties.desc: Whether CloudFront replaces HTTP status codes in the 4xx and 5xx range with custom error messages before returning the response to the viewer.

properties.name: DefaultCacheBehavior
properties.desc: The default cache behavior that is triggered if you do not specify the CacheBehavior property or if files don't match any of the values of PathPattern in the CacheBehavior property.

properties.name: DefaultRootObject
properties.desc: The object (such as index.html) that you want CloudFront to request from your origin when the root URL for your distribution (such as http://example.com/) is requested.

properties.name: Enabled
properties.desc: Controls whether the distribution is enabled to accept end user requests for content.

properties.name: Logging
properties.desc: Controls whether access logs are written for the distribution. To turn on access logs, specify this property.

properties.name: Origins
properties.desc: A list of origins for this CloudFront distribution. For each origin, you can specify whether it is an Amazon S3 or custom origin.

properties.name: PriceClass
properties.desc: The price class that corresponds with the maximum price that you want to pay for the CloudFront service. For more information, see Choosing the Price Class in the Amazon CloudFront Developer Guide.

properties.name: Restrictions
properties.desc: Specifies restrictions on who or how viewers can access your content.

properties.name: ViewerCertificate
properties.desc: The certificate to use when viewers use HTTPS to request objects.

properties.name: WebACLId
properties.desc: The AWS WAF web ACL to associate with this distribution. AWS WAF is a web application firewall that enables you to monitor the HTTP and HTTPS requests that are forwarded to CloudFront and to control who can access your content. CloudFront permits or forbids requests based on conditions that you specify, such as the IP addresses from which requests originate or the values of query strings.
